title: Mechanical energy - student lifts ball - bar chart

content.question: A student lifts a ball straight upward at a constant speed. The energy bar diagrams represent the gravitational potential energy <math alttext="U sub G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>G</mi></msub></math> of the ball-Earth system and the kinetic energy <math alttext="K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>K</mi></math> of the ball at a time <math alttext="t equals t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and at a later time <math alttext="t equals t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>. Which of the following energy bar diagrams correctly represents the change in mechanical energy <math alttext="delta E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>E</mi></math> of the ball-Earth system for the time interval <math alttext="delta t equals, t sub f minus t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>?
